content:
• Monday, December 15, 2014
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy EPS in-line, beats on revenue

    • FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL): FQ4 EPS of -$0.02 in-line.
    • Revenue of $54.4M (-1.4% Y/Y) beats by $1.53M.
    • Shares +3.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 5 Comments

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: IAG +10.8%. PRTA +10.7%. AG +9.5%. NGD +7.2%. CDE +7.1%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BBEP -2.9%. DGII -2.3%. VIIX -1.8%. WIT -1.6%. NOW -1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing boosts buyback along with dividend

    • Alongside a 25% increase in the dividend, Boeing (NYSE:BA) lifts its repurchase authorization to $12B from the $4.8B which had been remaining. Buybacks for 2014 are complete at $6B, and are expected to resume in the new year.
    • Previously: The Boeing Company declares $0.91 dividend (Dec. 15, 2014)
    • Shares +2.4% after hours, following a 1.1% gain in the regular session.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 9 Comments
  • PAY

    VeriFone +3.8% AH; EPS guidance light, revenue guidance in-line

    • VeriFone (NYSE:PAY) expects FQ1 revenue of $480M-$485M and EPS of $0.40 vs. a consensus of $482.9M and $0.45. FY15 (ends Oct. '15) guidance is for revenue of $2.02B-$2.04B and EPS of $1.85-$1.90 vs. a consensus of $2.03B and $1.97.
    • FQ4 system revenue +19.9% Y/Y to $310.9M; services +4.5% to $179.6M. North America revenue +19.6% to $149M; EMEA +5.2% to $189.4M; Latin America +16% to $82.1M; Asia-Pac +23.6% to $70.2M.
    • Though revenue was up 13% Y/Y, G&A spend fell 6.8% to $50.6M. Sales/marketing spend grew 2.7% to $56.3M, and R&D grew 9.2% to $50M. Free cash flow was $29.4M.
    • FQ4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone Systems beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • VeriFone Systems (NYSE:PAY): FQ4 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $491M (+13.6% Y/Y) beats by $7.58M.
    • Shares +1.45% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • QTWW

    Quantum Fuel +20% on insider buying flurry

    • Quantum Fuel Systems (QTWW +20.5%) is surging after disclosures of multiple insider buys; the CFO disclosed a purchase of 10K shares worth a total of $19.5K, and two directors disclosed purchases of 15K shares worth a combined total of $30K.
    • QTWW also says it delivered the first hydrogen dispensing system that measures hydrogen mass with connectivity to retail interface and user friendly payment features.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • WYY

    WidePoint down 10.8% going into the close

    • WidePoint (NYSEMKT:WYY) has tumbled to new 52-week lows. Volume (566K shares) is soundly above a 3-month average of 384K.
    • Shares have gradually moved lower after the IT/telecom services firm posted an EPS miss (to go with a slight revenue beat) in November thanks to a 32% Y/Y increase in opex.
    • Last week, WidePoint announced a federal agency client had exercised a $4.5M contract option for a wireless services order.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • BHP

    BHP Billiton downgraded at RBC as financial flexibility looks weak

    • BHP Billiton (BHP -2.6%) is downgraded to Underperform from Sector Perform at RBC Capital, which says BHP's cash flow metrics look weaker than its peers over the next two years.
    • The firm questions the timing of BHP's South32 spinoff of its aluminum, nickel, silver and coal divisions amidst potential structural change in oil and iron ore, seeing it as a case of "good idea, bad timing."
    • BHP needs $16B-$20B in operating cash flow just to cover its capex and dividend requirements, which would be problematic if commodity prices continue to slide, RBC says.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 3 Comments

  • Another failed rally for oil

    • WTI crude oil (USO -3.6%) has now tumbled below $56 per barrel after pushing up near $59 earlier today. The move has taken the starch out a bounce in the Energy Select SPDR (XLE -0.6%) which earlier had been one of the stronger stock market sectors on the session.
    • Previously: OPEC has no target price (Dec. 14, 2014)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    BlackBerry slides ahead of earnings; analysts cautious

    • Ahead of Friday morning's FQ3 report, BlackBerry (BBRY -2.9%) has dropped to its lowest levels since mid-October. With the company having only 1 buy rating among sell-side firms to go with 23 neutral ratings and 13 bearish ones (per Thomson/First Call), pre-earnings commentary has been fairly cautious.
    • "We continue to see headaches for the services business," says Credit Suisse (Underperform). It thinks BlackBerry, which last month forecast its services revenue would drop 50% in FY16, will see services revenue drop 17% Q/Q in FQ3 to $350.7M due to subscriber losses, ARPU pressure from carrier renegotiations, and challenges in monetizing the EZ Pass (BES migration) licensing program in "a competitive MDM market environment."
    • Raymond James (Market Perform) is encouraged by the fact BlackBerry had 5.1M EZ Pass licenses as of its November update (up from 3.4M as of Sep. 26), but adds this "does not mean much until we see actual paying conversions." It sees BlackBerry reaching cash flow breakeven in calendar Q4 2015.
    • BMO (Market Perform) believes hardware revenue will miss consensus, as declining legacy hardware sales offset Passport growth. However, it thinks "quarterly results are less meaningful than signs of software monetization," which it doesn't expect to see "true indicators" of until the FQ4 report.
    • Goldman (Neutral) is relatively positive: Though expecting a largely in-line FQ3, it sees FQ4 EPS beating expectations with the help of strong BlackBerry Classic (officially launches on Wednesday) sales, and thinks a short-squeeze is possible.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 108 Comments
  • BP

    EC clears BP acquisition of aviation fuel supplier

    • The European Commission gives conditional clearance for BP (BP -3.1%) to acquire jet fuel business Statoil Fuel and Retail Aviation (STO), subject to conditions.
    • The competition authorities say BP had committed to divesting SFRA's activities at Stockholm, Malmo, Gothenburg and Copenhagen airports to remove concerns that increased concentration there would have led to price increases of fuel for airlines.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • DAKP

    Dakota Plains +25% as Lone Star says MLP structure would add value

    • Dakota Plains (OTC:DAKP +25.2%) soars after Lone Star Value Management, the company's largest shareholder with aggregate ownership of ~7.3% of outstanding shares, issues an open letter to DAKP's board which says significant additional value can be created with an MLP structure for the Pioneer transloading facility.
    • Lone Star says its analysis shows DAKP's assets inside an MLP structure could be valued at $3.55-$4.85/share based on DAKP's earnings potential by year-end 2015 once Pioneer is transporting 80K bbl/day of oil; also, if further capital investment is made so that Pioneer can transport its full facility capacity of 160K bbl/day, DAKP's potential future value in a few years could approach $7.70-$10.20/share inside an MLP structure.
    • Shares surged Friday on news that expansion of the Pioneer facility remains on schedule and is fully funded.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter -7% following Utica well blowout

    • Magnum Hunter Resources (MHR -7.2%) swoons to 52-week lows after reporting yesterday that a subsidiary lost control of a well in Ohio's Utica shale.
    • The natural gas well, which had been drilled and completed, had been temporarily plugged and abandoned as MHR prepared to drill three other horizontal wells on the Stalder pad, but the well began to flow uncontrollably when production operations restarted.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 8 Comments
  • TOUR

    JD.com, Ctrip invest in travel site Tuniu

    • Chinese packaged tours site Tuniu (TOUR +2.3%) is raising $148M from JD.com (JD -3.8%), Ctrip (CTRP -4.5%), investment firm Hony Capital, and Tuniu's CEO and COO at a price equal to $12.06 per ADS (9% below Friday's close).
    • JD.com and Hony are each investing $50M; Ctrip is investing $15M; and Tuniu's CEO and COO are investing $16.5M apiece. Thanks to the deal, Tuniu has abandoned plans to raise funds through a public stock offering.
    • In April, Ctrip invested $200M in local attraction ticket-seller LY.com. A year ago, it took part in a $60M funding round for online car rental firm Yongche.
    • JD and Ctrip are among a slew of Chinese Internet stocks selling off today.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • SPHS

    Investors punish Sophiris

    • Investors take umbrage at Sophiris Bio (SPHS -79.6%) over the failure of PRX302 to achieve its efficacy endpoint in an interim analysis of a trial assessing it for the treatment of lower urinary tract symptoms in BPH.
    • Previously: Sophiris Bio's topsalysin fails to demonstrate efficacy for BPH-associated urinary tract symptoms (Dec. 15, 2014)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARDX

    Ardelyx slumps

    • Thinly-traded recent IPO Ardelyx (ARDX -24.1%) is off big albeit on modest turnover of 185K. Shares have now corrected 35% from the high of $35.48 on December 4.
    • Note: the lock-up period expires tomorrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • SRNE

    Sorrento up on news of collaboration with Abraxane inventor

    • Thinly-traded nano cap Sorrento Therapeutics (SRNE +26.9%) jumps on a 10x surge in volume in response to its announcement of a strategic collaboration with a subsidiary of NantWorks to develop next generation immunotherapies for the treatment of cancer and auto-immune diseases. The partners will make establish "The Immunotherapy Antibody JV" with $20M of joint funding. As part of the agreement, the Nantworks subsidiary will establish a 19.9% equity stake in Sorrento at a per-share price of $5.80 as well as warrants to purchase 1,724,138 additional shares at $5.80.
    • The JV will focus on accelerating the development of multiple immuno-oncology monoclonal antibodies including, but not limited to, anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1 and anti-CTLA4.
    • NantWorks' founder is California-based Dr. Patrick-Soon Shiong, the world's richest doctor by virtue of the sale of two of his companies, Abraxis (to Celgene) and American Pharmaceutical Partners (to Fresenius) for a combined $9.1B. He is also the inventor Abraxane (paclitaxel) and a part owner of the Los Angeles Lakers.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • CRNT

    Ceragon cutting 14% of workforce; shares +4.6%

    • Ceragon's (NASDAQ:CRNT) job cuts, along with other cost-cutting efforts, are meant to lower the company's quarterly opex to $21M-$22M by Q2 2015 from a current $26M-$27M.
    • Thanks to the cuts, Ceragon is now aiming to become profitable by Q2; the 2015 EPS consensus is right at breakeven. A $10M-$12M Q4 charge is expected.
    • Also: Ceragon says it expects to record $19M in "additional financial expense" in Q4, thanks to a $20M Venezuelan forex charge. The charge is blamed on "continued Venezuelan government policy that limits our customers' ability to pay such receivables in U.S. dollars."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • VHC

    VirnetX, Document Security slide after Vringo/Unwired Planet rulings

    • Vringo was denied a request for an en banc review of the adverse appeals court ruling its received in August for its infringement suit against Google. Unwired Planet received an unfavorable claim construction ruling for its own suit against Google.
    • Shares of both of the aforementioned companies are down over 30%. Fellow IP licensing firms VirnetX (VHC -8%) and Document Security (DSS -6.8%) are following them lower, albeit on modest volume.
    • VHC and DSS have received adverse rulings of their own this year (I, II), as courts take a tougher stance towards IP firms following the Supreme Court's June software patent ruling.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 3 Comments
  • PHMD

    The long slide of PhotoMedex continues

    • Thinly-traded nano cap PhotoMedex (PHMD -17.5%) slumps yet again. Shares have cratered 93% from the high of $16.82 on March 18. Clearly, the expected synergy of LCA-Vision has yet to materialize.
    • Previously: LCA Vision to be acquired by PhotoMedex for $5.37/share (Feb. 13, 2014)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • XONE

    3D printing stocks fall to new 52-week lows

    • ExOne (XONE -8.7%) and Voxeljet (VJET -9.8%) are among the biggest tech decliners on a day the Nasdaq is down 0.4%. 3D Systems (DDD -3.4%) and Stratasys (SSYS -1.4%) are also underperforming.
    • 3D Systems, Stratasys, and Voxeljet have made new 52-week lows, and ExOne is very close to doing the same. 3D Systems now goes for 3.3x 2015E sales exc. net cash, and Stratasys 3.9x 2015E sales exc. net cash.
    • Last Friday: Canaccord expects a 2015 rebound for 3D printing stocks
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 10 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: SRNE +24%. MFI +23%. TLM +20%. CRUS +20%. OTC:DAKP +20%.  HGSH +19%.  FRO +18%. QTWW +17%. MPO +15%. NYNY +13%.
    • Losers: SPHS -79%. UPIP -42%. CGG-OLD -27%. ARDX -23%. PHMD -19%. ANFI -15%. LNCO -15%. IKGH -14%. LINE -13%.   JRJC -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 17 Comments
  • GIMO

    Gigamon +3.7% on Raymond James upgrade

    • Raymond James has upgraded Gigamon (NYSE:GIMO) to Outperform, and set a $20 target.
    • The network monitoring/visibility hardware vendor is now up 67% from an October low of $9.96, but still down 41% YTD. Shares jumped on Oct. 24 in response to a Q3 beat and above-consensus guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo -13.4%; en banc petition for Google suit denied

    • The federal appeals court that ruled against Vringo (VRNG) in its infringement suit against Google has denied its petition for en banc review of the ruling.
    • Vringo says it will now seek a Supreme Court review. Lawyer David Boies: "This case presents important questions of patent law and the role of juries in patent cases that require further review. The dissenting opinion is a powerful signal that this case warrants attention."
    • The SC only hears a small fraction of the cases appealed to it. Federal courts have been frequently ruling against IP licensing firms this year, as Unwired Planet can attest.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 8 Comments
  • BLUE

    Investors bagging some profits on BLUE, SGMO

    • Investors take some money off the table in early trading of bluebird bio (BLUE -4.4%) and Sangamo BioSciences (SGMO -8%). bluebird gapped up on December 9 after its announcement of positive clinical trial results for LentiGlobin BB305 for the treatment of beta-thalassemia. Sangamo followed suit, albeit more modestly, on the basis of its investigational product for the same indication.
    • Previously: bluebird bio's LentiGlobin delivers impressive results in beta-thalassemia, shares jump (Dec. 9, 2014)
    • Previously: Sangamo rides bluebird's wave (Dec. 9, 2014)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • PSX

    BofA upgrades Phillips 66 amid multiple downgrades of refining stocks

    • BofA Merrill analyst Doug Leggate stays cautious on the refining sector for 2015, although he sees a bullish opportunity in Phillips 66 (PSX +0.5%), which he upgrades to Buy from Neutral with a $90 price target.
    • The expected recognition of value risks being materially overhyped compared to what is currently being recognized by MLPs, the analyst says, adding that absence of guidance on the cost impact on the remaining business, limited guidance on tax and lack of precision on disclosure prompts skepticism that the market is not getting ahead of itself.
    • Leggate downgrades HollyFrontier (HFC -1.5%) to Neutral from Buy, and PBF Energy (PBF -1.9%) and Delek US (DK -1.9%) to Underperform from Neutral; he also lowers stock price targets for the three, as well as for Valero (VLO +0.4%), Northern Tier (NTI -2.5%) and Marathon Petroleum (MPC -1.1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 25 Comments
  • BDSI

    BioDelivery Sciences still rolling over

    • BioDelivery Sciences International (BDSI -11.4%) slumps on double normal volume. Shares are now down 34% from the peak of $18.48 on September 12.
    • Investors appear concerned over the encroachment of Orexo's Zubsolv (buprenorphine and naloxone) into Bunavail's U.S. business. The FDA recently approved two new buprenorphine dosages for Zubsolv, 8.6 mg and 11.4 mg, that could drive an increase in market share. Bunavail's buprenorphine dosages are 2.1 mg, 4.2 mg and 6.3 mg.
    • Previously: U.S. launch of Bunavail commences (Nov. 3, 2014)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras -10% as probe curtails full Q3 earnings report

    • Another day, another new 52-week low for Petrobras (PBR -10.2%), after the company released a summary of its Q3 results but not its financial statements, as it continues to assess the impact of the Brazilian government's corruption investigation on some of its assets.
    • J.P. Morgan says the partial release likely will overshadow what they foresee as "good operational results," although the firm likes PBR's plan to minimize the issuance of incremental debt in 2015 and that executive officers approved an action plan to maintain the cash level and the liquidity of the company.
    • Meanwhile, Brazilian prosecutors formally charge four more people, including the former head of PBR's distribution subsidiary.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 14 Comments
  • YNDX

    Yandex, Qiwi, VimpelCom, MTS slammed thanks to ruble's crash

    • The ruble is down over 6% today against the dollar amid ongoing worries about weak oil prices, sanctions, and capital flight. Yandex (YNDX -8.2%), Qiwi (QIWI -12.4%), VimpelCom (VIP -8.6%), and MTS (MBT -11.2%) are all seeing huge losses.
    • Yandex rallied on Friday after Google announced it's shutting down its Russian engineering office. With the ruble/dollar conversion rate now at 62:1 (up from less than 40:1 earlier this year), Yandex trades for 21x 2015E EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 5 Comments
  • AUQ

    AuRico Gold discovers new gold-copper porphyry at Kemess project

    • AuRico Gold (AUQ +3.6%) says it discovered a new gold-copper porphyry at Kemess East near the Kemess mill facility.
    • AUQ says the discovery demonstrates the significant potential of the Kemess land package, with some of the program's drill holes ending in mineralization.
    • AUQ says it plans to have an initial resource estimate for Kemess East in early 2015, after an initial mineralogical assessment indicated it is similar to the Kemess Underground deposit.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • NOW

    ServiceNow gains; RBC makes company a Top Pick

    • RBC has upgraded ServiceNow (NOW +2.3%) to Top Pick from Outperform, and hiked its target by $10 to $70.
    • Last week, BofA launched coverage on the cloud IT service desk software leader with a Buy rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • QRVO

    RF Micro, TriQuint slump on D.A. Davidson downgrades

    • Citing valuation, D.A. Davidson has downgraded RF Micro (RFMD -3.8%) and TriQuint (TQNT -3.8%), soon to jointly be known as Qorvo, to Neutral. Its targets are respectively $16 and $27.
    • RF Micro is up 156%, and TriQuint is up 170%, since the RF component vendors announced their "merger of equals" on Feb. 24.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic now +19.2% on Barclays' upgrade/iPhone report

    • Barclays' upgrade and prediction that Cirrus Logic's (NASDAQ:CRUS) iPhone chip content will rise 25%-50% in the 6S is being very well-received. 7.4M shares have already been traded, over 5x a 3-month daily average of 1.3M.
    • With 8.3M shares (13% of the float) shorted as of Nov. 28, short-covering is likely contributing to today's big gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 4 Comments
  • ITUB

    Goldman pulls the plug on Itau Unibanco buy recommendation

    • Downgrading Itau Unibanco (ITUB -3.1%) to Neutral from Buy, Goldman Sachs also reiterates its Sell rating on Banco Santander Brasil (BSBR -3.8%).
    • Itau Unibanco has managed to stay flat year-to-date, while Santander has shed 21%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • GEC

    Unwired Planet -39.8%; negative ruling received for Google case

    • Unwired Planet (UPIP) has received a claim construction order (.pdf) for five of the patents asserted in a 2012 infringement suit against Google. The company states its "initial perception is that these results are disappointingly negative and will materially impact our case." Options are being evaluated.
    • UPIP sued Apple and Google in 2012, alleging the tech giants infringed a slew of patents related to hardware, wireless communications, and cloud services. Earlier this year, it sued Google, Samsung, Huawei, and HTC over six of the patents it acquired from Ericsson.
    • The order is the latest in a string of negative rulings to be received this year by IP licensing firms suing major tech companies.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM

  • Ruble tumbles

    • For the first time ever, it takes more than 60 rubles to buy a dollar after the currency's more than 6% plunge today. Alongside the ruble's disappearance are rising yields on Russian yields providing a double-whammy to energy companies already dealing with crashing oil prices.
    • “There’s just not enough dollars there. Sanctions, capital flight, low oil prices — its feeding into this weakness,” says Win Thin, head of emerging market currency strategy at Brown Brothers Harriman.
    • The Micex is lower by 1.9% on the session. RSX -6.3%
    • ETFs: RSX, RUSL, RUSS, RSXJ, ERUS, RBL
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 15 Comments
  • CYOU

    Sohu +3.3%, Changyou +3.9% on JPMorgan upgrade

    • JPMorgan is making a contrarian call on SOHU, upgrading the Chinese search/portal/online gaming provider to Overweight. Subsidiary Changyou (NASDAQ:CYOU) is also rallying.
    • Sohu was down 34% YTD going into today. Shares have gradually trended lower since Sohu/Changyou provided mixed Q3 results and light Q4 guidance in early November, and announced Changyou CEO Tao Wang has resigned.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • RRC

    Range Resources +3.4% on 2015 capex budget, record Utica well results

    • Range Resources (RRC +3.4%) sets its 2015 capital spending budget at $1.3B, an 18% Y/Y decrease, while expecting to continue to deliver Y/Y production growth of 20%-25% due to improving capital efficiencies from its activities in the Marcellus Shale.
    • RRC also says its Utica/Point Pleasant well in Pennsylvania achieved an average 24-hour test rate of 59M cf/day; RRC believes the initial production rate equating to a 10.9M cf/day per 1K ft. of lateral is a record for any horizon drilled in the Appalachian Basin and the highest IP rate of any Utica well.
    • Separately, CEO Jeff Ventura will add Chairman to his title beginning Jan. 1, replacing John Pinkerton.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • CY

    Cypress, Spansion make fresh 52-week highs on Wedbush upgrade

    • Wedbush has upgraded Cypress Semi (CY +2.9%) to Outperform, and hiked its target to $18. 50/50 merger partner Spansion (CODE +3%) is naturally following Cypress higher.
    • Cypress and Spansion both received upgrades two weeks ago after announcing their merger; analysts praised the deal's cost synergies, tax savings (CODE has $900M worth of NOLs), and memory/microcontroller product synergies.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • JMEI

    Jumei announces buyback, sells off

    • With shares down 39% from their IPO price going into today, Jumei (JMEI -3.6%) has announced a $100M buyback. It's good for 12 months, and can be used to repurchase 5% of shares at current levels.
    • Nonetheless, Jumei is selling off on a morning when the Nasdaq is up 0.5%. The Chinese online cosmetics leader is close to its post-IPO low of $12.87 (set last Thursday).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 3 Comments
  • MEG

    Broadcast TV stocks show gains

    • Select broadcast TV stocks are higher after the FCC approves the merger between Media General and LIN Media.
    • Shares of the new combined company will trade under the Media General name and symbol after the deal closes later this month.
    • Some media analysts think further consolidation within the sector is likely.
    • Broadcasters: Media General (NYSE:MEG) +3.7%, LIN Media (OTC:LIN) +3.0%, Nexstar Broadcasting Group (NASDAQ:NXST) +1.4%, Journal Communications (NYSE:JRN) +1.0%, Liberty Ventures (LVNTA) +0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • FUEL

    Rocket Fuel names new CFO; shares higher

    • Dave Sankaran, whose resume includes stints as the CFO of three software firms (and the CEO of one), is Rocket Fuel's (FUEL +2%) new CFO.
    • Sankaran's appointment comes three months after Rocket Fuel announced CFO Peter Bardwick is stepping down. Shares are outperforming amid a market rally.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • TLM

    Bloomberg: Canada Pension considering Talisman bid

    • Talisman Energy (TLM +21.2%) explodes higher at the open as Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY, OTCQX:REPYF) closes in on a deal and Canada Pension Plan Investment Board reportedly weighs a bid for the Canadian oil and gas explorer.
    • Bloomberg reports that Canada Pension is considering making a bid for the whole company after initially considered buying parts of it, perhaps emboldened by a 59% YTD plunge in TLM.
    • Expansion is reporting that Repsol’s board is meeting today to approve a TLM bid.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 4 Comments
  • TWTR

    Twitter rallies on bullish JMP launch

    • JMP Securities has launched coverage on Twitter (TWTR +2.3%) with an Outperform rating and $49 target.
    • Among other things, JMP cites Twitter's reach, differentiated content, ad growth potential, and improving margins.
    • Shares had slumped to new 5-month lows last week before bouncing a little.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 3 Comments
  • AVGO

    Broadcom gains on Evercore upgrade

    • Evercore ISI has upgraded Broadcom (BRCM +3%) to Buy, and hiked its target by $10 to $55.
    • The upgrade comes six day after Broadcom (at its analyst day) hiked its Q4 guidance and announced new capital return efforts. Shares +46% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • VER

    Uneventful conference call at American Realty

    • The company notes that although the investigation isn't over, Nick Schorsch hasn't been accused of anything improper.
    • Previously: American Realty cutting all business ties with Schorsch (Dec. 15, 2014)
    • Previously: Heads roll at American Realty Capital; shares -10% (Dec. 15, 2014)
    • ARCP -9.4%
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 12 Comments
  • ORCL

    Oracle +3.8% on pre-earnings Morgan Stanley upgrade

    • Citing "improving results in secularly important portions of the business" against a backdrop of "very low expectations and weak sentiment," Morgan Stanley has upgraded Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) ahead of Wednesday's FQ2 report, and hiked its target by $5 to $50.
    • Oracle's performance nearly matches the Nasdaq's this year. Shares go for 11x estimated FY16 (ends May '16) EPS exc. net cash.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine higher on Mexican pipeline order

  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic +7.5%; Barclays upgrades, sees iPhone content gains

    • "We believe CRUS will see content in the iPhone 6S next year increase and we believe CRUS' next-gen 55nm smart codec will integrate a low-power DSP to enable 'always-on voice,'" writes Barclays, upgrading to Overweight and hiking its target by $10 to $28.
    • Barclays sees Cirrus' chip content rising to $2.50-$3.00 from $2 in current iPhones, and also thinks its next-gen smart codec will likely go into Samsung's Galaxy S6. The Moto X and some other Android phones have already integrated always-on voice.
    • The adoption of Cirrus' smart codec/DSP solution by Android OEMs would represent a fresh challenge for Audience (NASDAQ:ADNC), which offers its Always-on VoiceQ solution to enable touchless device waking.
    • A year ago, Barclays was among the first to report Cirrus didn't have an audio amplifier slot in the iPad Air.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • VER

    American Realty cutting all business ties with Schorsch

    • In addition to the exit of Nick Schorsch along with the CEO and COO from the company, American Realty Capital (ARCP) will be unwinding all of its relationships with entities in which Schorsch maintains an executive or director-level role, or is a significant stockholder.
    • RCS Capital (NYSE:RCAP) immediately comes to mind, and it's lower by 2% premarket. Schorsch is also chairman at New York REIT (NYSE:NYRT).
    • Bruce Frank has joined ARCP's audit committee as its chairman, and the committee continues to work with its advisors to complete the investigation into the company's financial statements.
    • Morgan Stanley continues to advise the company on capital structure, business strategy, and capital allocation.
    • Previously: Heads roll at American Realty Capital; shares -10%
    • ARCP -11.6% premarket
    • A conference call is just getting underway.

  • OPK

    Pfizer adds to pipeline with Opko deal

    • Opko Health (NYSEMKT:OPK) is up 14% premarket on robust volume in response to its deal with Pfizer (NYSE:PFE). The latter will be pay Opko an upfront fee of $295M and up to $275M in regulatory milestones for the global rights to hGH-CTP, a long-acting growth hormone. Its value proposition is a once-weekly injection, a significant improvement over the once-daily standard of care.
    • Opko acquired the rights to hGH-CTP via its takeout of Israel-based Prolor last year.
    • Previously: Opko completes its acquisition of Prolor Biotech (Aug. 29, 2013)

  • CGG-OLD

    Technip drops pursuit of oil services firm CGG

    • CGG-OLD -31% in Paris trading after Technip (TKPPY) says it is abandoning its pursuit of the company and will not make an offer directly to investors.
    • Last month, Technip offered to acquire the French oil services company for €1.46B ($1.82B) but CGG rejected the approach.
    • The proposal would have combined Technip, which provides engineering and construction services to the energy industry, with CGG, a provider of equipment and geological data processing services to the sector.

  • HON

    Honeywell higher premarket on 2015 guidance

    • Honeywell (NYSE:HON) has lowered its Q4 sales forecast to $10.1B-10.2B from $10.3-10.4B, but reaffirmed its $1.37-$1.42 EPS estimate for the quarter.
    • FY14 sales are expected to be in a range of $40.1-$40.2B, down from previous guidance of $40.3B-$40.4B. FY14 EPS is still anticipated to be in a range of $5.50-$5.55.
    • The company forecasts 2015 organic sales growth of ~4%, up 1-2% Y/Y at $40.5B-$41.1B. 2015 EPS is expected to be between $5.95-$6.15, with free cash flow of $4.2-$4.3B.
